result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcus J. Kilgore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Marcus J. Kilgore is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Marcus J. Kilgore was found guilty of Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If revoked, the defendant entitled to 2 days credit, subject to verification of the jail.

miscConds.notes: Full time employment, at least 34 hrs per week, or provide agent with 3 job applications per week until full time employment is obtained.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcus J. Kilgore

records.addlTxt: 3:41 PM Defendant Marcus J. Kilgore in court.  Attorney Michael Yang in court for Marcus J. Kilgore.  Attorney Curtis E Johnson in court for State of Wisconsin. State recites joint recommendation:  Ct 2: dimissed.  Ct 1:  W/H 24 mo probaiton:  absolute sobriety; AODA and follow through; full time employment, at least 34 hrs/week, or provide agent with 3 job applications per week until full time employment obtained; 10 hrs comm service; restitution = $7.99 to Cobb Food Mart.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form - colloquy given.  Defendant freely, willingly, knowledgeably and intelligently enters into the plea agreement and joint recommendation. Court accepts the joint recommendation and sentences the defendant accordingly.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 20, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Atty. Curtis Johnson appears for the State of Wisconsin, Atty. Michael Yang appears in person, Marcus Kilgore appears in person.  Ct. hears from Atty. Johnson and Atty. Yang and sets plea/sentencing for 9/20/2022 at 2:00 p.m.
Status conference on August 25, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
to Judge Craig Day

1:30 PM Defendant Marcus J. Kilgore in court.  Attorney Curtis E Johnson in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Michael Yang appeared by phone for Marcus J. Kilgore.  Waiver of Preliminary Hearing - colloquy given.  Defendant freely, willingly, knowledgeably and intelligently waives right to preliminary hearing.  Information filed. Waiver of formal reading of the information.  Defendant stands mute - not guilty plea entered.  Motion to modify bond addressed, State objects to bond modification.    Court grants modification.
Status conference scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
